title: AI Assistant
description: GoCards AI Assistant helps you create, update, and delete flashcards using natural language. Powered by Gemini or ChatGPT.
content:
## What the AI Can Do The AI Assistant is a chat panel available inside any deck. You can ask it to: * **Create cards** ‚Äî describe a topic and the AI generates term/definition pairs and adds them directly to your deck * **Update cards** ‚Äî ask to rephrase, expand, or correct existing cards * **Delete cards** ‚Äî remove cards by describing which ones to remove * **Suggest improvements** ‚Äî ask for feedback on card quality or coverage The AI is aware of your deck name and existing cards, so it can infer the topic without extra instructions. *** ## How to Open the AI Assistant 1. Open any deck (tap it from the **Deck List**) 2. Tap the **AI floating button** in the bottom-right corner of the screen The chat panel opens as a bottom sheet overlay ‚Äî your card list stays visible behind it.
*** ## Access Options There are two ways to use the AI: ### Option 1 ‚Äî Token Package (Gemini) 1. Tap **Login** inside the AI panel 2. Sign in with your Google account 3. Tap **Buy Tokens** to purchase a package of tokens 4. Start chatting ‚Äî tokens are deducted automatically per message The token balance is shown at the top of the chat panel. You can buy additional packages any time your balance is low. **Device requirements for purchasing:** The app must be installed from Google Play on a certified, non-rooted Android device with security updates within the last year. This is required by Google Play Integrity API to prevent fraud. *** ### Option 2 ‚Äî Your Own OpenAI API Key (BYOK) Use your own OpenAI account and API key ‚Äî no login to GoCards required. 1. Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **App Settings** ‚Üí **OpenAI API Key** 2. Paste your OpenAI API key 3. Open the AI panel in any deck and start chatting Charges are billed directly to your OpenAI account.
*** ## Related Topics * [Edit Card](/en/edit-card) - Manually add or edit cards * [App Settings](/en/settings/app) - Set your OpenAI API key * [Getting Started](/en/getting-started) - Create your first deck

title: Reordering Cards
description: GoCards supports intuitive drag-and-drop reordering in the Cards List, allowing you to arrange your flashcards in any order you prefer.
content:
## How to Reorder Cards

### Drag-and-Drop Method

1. **Long-press a card** (hold for approximately 1 second)
2. **Drag the card** up or down to your desired position
3. **Release** to drop the card in place
4. The card slides into its new position, and all other cards automatically renumber

### Multi-Select Cut and Paste Method

1. **Long-press a card** (hold for approximately 1 second) to enter multi-select mode
2. **Tap additional cards** to add them to your selection
3. **Long-press the card** after which you want to move your selected cards
4. The multi-select action menu appears
5. **Tap "Paste"**
6. Selected cards are moved to the new location

For more details, see [Multi-Select Operations](/en/cards-list/multi-select).

title: Database Backup & Restore
description: Database backups preserve everything all decks, cards, settings, and review history.
content:
## Why Back Up Your Database? * **Complete backup** - Saves all decks, progress, and settings in one file * **Device transfers** - Move your data to a new phone seamlessly * **Safety net** - Protect your data before syncing with Excel/CSV or making major changes *** ## Exporting Your Database **To export a database:** 1. Go to the **home screen** (Recent Decks or All Decks tab) 2. Tap **deck** ‚Üí **More (‚ãÆ)** ‚Üí **Export DB** 3. Choose save location ### What's Included in the Export The exported `.db` file contains: * ‚úÖ All cards in the deck * ‚úÖ Card content (terms and definitions) * ‚úÖ Learning progress (review intervals, memorization status) * ‚úÖ Deck settings and preferences
*** ## Importing a Database **To import a database:** 1. Go to the **home screen** (Recent Decks or All Decks tab) 2. Tap the **"‚ãÆ" menu** (top-right corner) -‚Üí **"Import DB"** 3. Choose the `.db` file from your device 4. Decks appear in All Decks list
*** ## Database vs. Excel/CSV Export Choose the right export format for your needs: | Feature | Database Export (.db) | Deck Export (Excel/CSV) | |---------|----------------------|-------------------------| | **All cards** | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚úÖ Yes | | **Learning progress** | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚ùå No | | **Review intervals** | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚ùå No | | **Deck settings** | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚ùå No | | **Term/Definition ratio** | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚ùå No | | **Font size settings** | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚ùå No | | **Editable on computer** | ‚ùå No | ‚úÖ Yes | | **Sync with file** | ‚ùå No | ‚úÖ Yes | ### When to Use Database Export * Creating complete backups with all progress * Transferring data to a new device * Taking snapshots before major changes * Preserving your learning history ### When to Use Excel/CSV Export * Editing cards in Excel or Google Sheets * Sharing deck content with others (without progress) * Syncing cards between devices using files * Bulk editing card content *** ## Recommended Storage Locations **Cloud storage (recommended):** * **Google Drive** * **Dropbox** * **OneDrive** *** ## Related Topics * [Export Cards](/en/sync-export-import/export-cards) - Export deck content as Excel/CSV * [Import Cards](/en/sync-export-import/import-cards) - Import decks from Excel/CSV * [Sync Cards](/en/sync-export-import/sync-cards) - Keep decks synchronized with files

title: Getting Started with GoCards
description: Welcome to GoCards! This guide will walk you through creating your first deck and starting your learning journey.
content:
## Your First Time Opening GoCards Let's start in the **All Decks** tab.
## Step 1: Create Your First Deck [Decks](/en/deck-list) are collections of flashcards organized by topic. Let's create your first one: 1. **Tap the "All Decks" tab** at the bottom 2. **Tap the "+" button** in the bottom-right corner 3. **Enter a name** for your deck (e.g., "Spanish Vocabulary", "Biology Terms") 4. **Tap "Create"**
Your new deck now appears in the list! ## Step 2: Open the Cards List The [cards list](/en/cards-list) is where you'll manage all the flashcards in your deck: 1. **Tap "‚ãÆ" on a deck** to open the deck menu. 2. **Select "List Cards"**
You'll see an empty list since we haven't added any cards yet. Let's fix that! ## Step 3: Add Your First Cards Now let's [add some cards](/en/edit-card/add-card) to your deck: 1. **Tap the "+" button** in the top-right corner 2. **Enter the Term** (the question - front of the card) 3. **Enter the Definition** (the answer - back of the card) 4. **Tap the save icon** (üíæ) to [save your card](/en/edit-card)
Repeat to add more cards. Later, you can enhance cards with [HTML formatting](/en/edit-card/html-tags), images, or even YouTube videos. ## Step 4: Study Your Cards Now it's time to start your [study session](/en/study)! 1. **Go back** to your deck (tap the back arrow) 2. **Tap on the deck** to enter study mode
### Your First Study Session In study mode, you'll see: * **Term** at the top (the question) * **Tap the bottom section** to reveal the definition (answer) * **Swipe left or right** to navigate between cards After revealing the answer, grade yourself based on how well you remembered: | Button | When to Use | Next Review | |--------|-------------|-------------| | **Again** (Red) | You forgot | Soon (stays in current session) | | **Quick** (Orange) | For cramming | 5 minutes | | **Hard** (Blue) | Remembered with difficulty | 3 days | | **Easy** (Green) | Remembered easily | 5 days | Each button shows when you'll see the card again. This is spaced repetition‚Äîthe app schedules reviews right before you're likely to forget, making learning more efficient. If you prefer to review cards without affecting your study schedule, try [Browse Mode](/en/browse-cards). *** ## Next Steps You've created your first deck and learned the basics! As you continue, you'll want to explore: **Edit cards more efficiently:** Instead of editing cards one-by-one on your phone, you can [sync with Excel or CSV files](/en/sync-export-import/sync-cards) on your computer. Make bulk changes with find-replace, then sync back‚Äîwithout losing your study progress. **Create richer cards:** Go beyond plain text with [HTML formatting](/en/edit-card/html-tags)‚Äîadd bold text, images, YouTube videos, and code syntax highlighting to make your cards more engaging. Happy studying! üéì

## Key Benefits

* **Swipe** to navigate and delete cards

HTML formatting, embedded YouTube videos, images, and bold text. Create engaging, multimedia flashcards that go beyond plain text.

### üíª Code Syntax Highlighting

Perfect for developers: `<pre><code>` blocks support syntax highlighting for technical flashcards and programming study.

### üîÑ Bi-directional Sync with Excel/CSV

Edit flashcards on your computer using **Excel, Google Sheets, LibreOffice Calc**, or any CSV editor. Changes sync both ways‚Äîedit in the app or on your computer, everything stays in harmony.

### üìä Never Lose Learning Progress

Your due dates, mastery levels, and learning statistics survive every sync. Update content without resetting your progress‚Äîthe core feature that sets GoCards apart.

### üñ•Ô∏è Edit on Computer

Use **Excel, Google Sheets, LibreOffice Calc**, or any spreadsheet software to edit your flashcards. Faster typing on a full keyboard, better organization with spreadsheet tools‚Äîmuch more efficient than editing on your phone.

### üñ•Ô∏è Bulk Editing Made Easy

Find-replace across hundreds of cards, copy-paste entire sections, and use spreadsheet formulas. Edit hundreds of cards in minutes instead of hours.

### ‚òÅÔ∏è Cloud Storage Integration

Save your synced file to Google Drive, Dropbox, or OneDrive. Edit on your laptop, save, and changes appear on your phone automatically. No manual transfers.

### ü§ù Easy Sharing & Backup

Share decks as standard Excel/CSV files‚Äîno proprietary formats. Your content is always readable and backed up outside the app.

### üéØ Spaced Repetition Learning

Smart scheduling shows you cards exactly when you're about to forget them, optimizing retention and minimizing study time.

Clean, distraction-free learning experience. Focus on studying, not avoiding pop-ups.

content:
## The Four Grading Buttons

After revealing the answer, grade how well you remembered:

### üî¥ Again (Red)

**Use when:** You forgot the card completely

**What happens:**

* Card stays in the current study session
* Reappears after you've studied/forgotten 5 more cards
* Next review: **2 days** (or current interval if already learned)
* Marks card as "forgotten" (visible in card list edge bar)

**Customization:** Change the "forgotten card limit" in [Deck Settings](/en/settings/all-decks#limit-forgotten-cards)

***

### üü† Quick Repetition (Orange)

**Use when:** Cramming for an exam or need short-term recall

**What happens:**

* First review: **5 minutes**
* Second review: **10 minutes**
* Third review: **20 minutes**
* Intervals keep doubling

**Perfect for:**

* Last-minute studying before exams
* Memorizing information needed in the next few hours
* Intensive drilling of difficult material

***

### üîµ Hard (Blue)

**Use when:** You remembered, but it took effort

**What happens:**

If this is your **first time** grading the card:

* Next review: **3 days**
* Subsequent reviews: **interval √ó 1.5**

If you previously clicked **"Again"**:

* Updates the failed attempt with **interval √ó 0.5**
* Creates new review with **interval √ó 1.5**

**Example progression:**

1. First: 3 days
2. Second: 4.5 days (3 √ó 1.5)
3. Third: 6.75 days (4.5 √ó 1.5)

***

### üü¢ Easy (Green)

**Use when:** You remembered quickly and confidently

**What happens:**

If this is your **first time** grading the card:

* Next review: **5 days**
* Subsequent reviews: **interval √ó 2**

If you previously clicked **"Again"**:

* Updates the failed attempt with **interval √ó 0.5**
* Marks card as memorized

**Example progression:**

1. First: 5 days
2. Second: 10 days (5 √ó 2)
3. Third: 20 days (10 √ó 2)
4. Fourth: 40 days (20 √ó 2)

***

## Understanding Review Intervals

The interval shown below each button is **when you'll see this card again**.

### How Intervals Work

**New cards** (never studied):

* Again: 2 days
* Quick: 5 minutes
* Hard: 3 days
* Easy: 5 days

**Previously studied cards:**

* Intervals adapt based on your history
* More "Easy" clicks = longer intervals
* "Again" clicks = shorter intervals
* The algorithm balances memory retention with study efficiency

### Why These Intervals?

GoCards uses **spaced repetition** based on memory research:

* Review just before you're about to forget
* Longer intervals strengthen long-term memory
* Too frequent = waste of time
* Too infrequent = you'll forget

title: Sync Cards with Excel/CSV Files
description: Keep your flashcard decks synchronized with Excel or CSV files stored in cloud storage. Edit your cards on a laptop, save to Google Drive or Dropbox, and changes automatically sync to your phone‚Äîall while preserving your study progress.
content:
## Why Sync Instead of Import?

**The Problem with Traditional Apps:**

Most flashcard apps only support importing files. Every time you update your flashcards, you have to delete the old deck and import a new one, losing all your study progress in the process.

**The GoCards Solution:**

Sync your deck once, then edit the file anytime. Changes flow automatically in both directions while your learning statistics, due dates, and mastery levels stay intact.

***

## How Sync Works

GoCards uses smart synchronization that compares modification dates to determine which source has the newest changes.

### Intelligent Card Matching

When syncing, GoCards automatically detects whether a card has been modified or is entirely new:

* üü† **Modified cards** - Updated if there's at least 70% similarity in the term or definition (prevents accidental overwrites)
* üü¢ **New cards** - Added automatically if similarity is below 70%
* üî¥ **Deleted cards** - Removed if they no longer exist in the source

This smart matching ensures your edits are preserved while preventing duplicate cards.

### What Gets Synced

**When the file is newer than the deck:**

* üü¢ New cards from the file are added
* üî¥ Deleted cards are removed
* üü† Modified cards are updated
* Card order matches the file
* Study progress is preserved

**When the card is newer than the file:**

* üü† Changes from the card are written back to the file
* Custom columns in your spreadsheet are preserved and move with their cards

***

## See It in Action

Watch how sync works in practice:

<center>
  <iframe width="395" height="700" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/rthjtSAq13A?si=ipRAJYeRNYG1ermM" title="YouTube video player" frameBorder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" referrerPolicy="strict-origin-when-cross-origin" allowFullScreen />
</center>

**What happens in this demo:**

1. A deck is exported to create a synced file
2. Changes are made to both the file (3 cards) and the app (3 cards)
3. Sync is triggered
4. The card list shows what changed with color indicators
5. Study progress remains intact despite the updates

***

## Visual Sync Indicators

After syncing, colored edge bars in your card list show exactly which cards changed.

Learn more in [Edge Bars](/en/cards-list/edge-bars).

***

## Key Benefits

‚úÖ **Preserve Study Progress** - Never lose your learning statistics again

‚úÖ **Bi-directional Sync** - Changes flow both ways automatically

‚úÖ **Edit Anywhere** - Update cards on laptop or phone

‚úÖ **Cloud Storage Integration** - Works with Google Drive, Dropbox, and more

‚úÖ **Smart Conflict Resolution** - Prevents accidental data loss with similarity checking

‚úÖ **Extra Data Preserved** - Keep custom columns in your spreadsheet intact

***

## Supported File Formats

**Excel (.xlsx, .xls)**

* Compatible with Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, LibreOffice Calc

**CSV (.csv)**

* Universal compatibility with any text editor or spreadsheet program

See the [File Format Guide](/en/sync-export-import/file-format/) for detailed specifications.
